explanation: Borussia Dortmund's lineup from the 1997 UEFA Champions League Final against Juventus is historically significant as it marked the club's first-ever Champions League title. Dortmund defeated Juventus 3-1, showcasing tactical brilliance under coach Ottmar Hitzfeld. Karl-Heinz Riedle scored twice, and Lars Ricken famously scored just seconds after coming on as a substitute, sealing the victory. This match is widely regarded as Dortmund's greatest achievement, highlighting a peak performance from a legendary squad.
